Item.Name: ObjectInstanceHandle
Item.Description: The object link is used to refer an Instance of a given Object. An Object link value is composed of two concatenated 16-bits unsigned integers following the Network Byte Order convention. The Most Significant Halfword is an ObjectID, the Least Significant Hafword is an ObjectInstance ID.An Object Link referencing no Object Instance will contain the concatenation of 2 MAX-ID values (null link.

Item.Name: ObjectVersion
Item.Description: LWM2M Object versioning label.

Item.Name: Digital Input State
Item.Description: The current state of a digital input.

Item.Name: Digital Input Counter
Item.Description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

Item.Name: Digital Input Polarity
Item.Description: The polarity of a digital input as a Boolean (0 = Normal, 1= Reversed)

Item.Name: Digital Input Debounce Period
Item.Description: The debounce period in ms.

Item.Name: Digital Input Edge Selection
Item.Description: The edge selection as an integer (1 = Falling edge, 2 = Rising edge, 3 = Both Rising and Falling edge)

Item.Name: Digital Input Counter Reset
Item.Description: Reset the Counter value

Item.Name: Current Time
Item.Description: Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

Item.Name: Digital Output State
Item.Description: The polarity of a digital input as a Boolean (0 = Normal, 1= Reversed)

Item.Name: Digital Output Polarity
Item.Description: The polarity of a digital input as a Boolean (0 = Normal, 1= Reversed)

Item.Name: Analog Input Current Value
Item.Description: The current state of the analogue input.

Item.Name: Min Measured Value
Item.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since it is ON or Reset.

Item.Name: Max Measured Value
Item.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since it is ON or Reset

Item.Name: Min Range Value
Item.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Max Range Value
Item.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Item.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value

Item.Name: Analog Output Current Value
Item.Description: The current state of the analogue output.

Item.Name: Sensor Value
Item.Description: If present, the value of the sensor.

Item.Name: Sensor Units
Item.Description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

Item.Name: X Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the X axis.

Item.Name: Y Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the Y axis.

Item.Name: Z Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the Z axis.

Item.Name: Compass Direction
Item.Description: The compass direction indicated by the calibrated magnetic field

Item.Name: Colour
Item.Description: A string representing a value in some color space

Item.Name: Application Type
Item.Description: The Application type of the device, for example “Motion Closure”.

Item.Name: Sensor Type
Item.Description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type)

Item.Name: Instantaneous active power
Item.Description: The current active power

Item.Name: Min Measured active power
Item.Description: The minimum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Item.Name: Max Measured active power
Item.Description: The maximum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Item.Name: Min Range active power
Item.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Max Range active power
Item.Description: The maximum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Cumulative active power
Item.Description: The cumulative active power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start

Item.Name: Active Power Calibration
Item.Description: Request an active power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Item.Name: Instantaneous reactive power
Item.Description: The current reactive power

Item.Name: Min Measured reactive power
Item.Description: The minimum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Item.Name: Max Measured reactive power
Item.Description: The maximum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON

Item.Name: Min Range reactive power
Item.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Max Range reactive power
Item.Description: The maximum reactive power that can be measured by the sensor

Item.Name: Cumulative reactive power
Item.Description: The cumulative reactive power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start

Item.Name: Reactive Power Calibration
Item.Description: Request a reactive power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Item.Name: Power factor
Item.Description: If applicable, the power factor of the current consumption.

Item.Name: Current Calibration
Item.Description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient

Item.Name: Reset Cumulative energy
Item.Description: Reset both cumulative active/reactive power

Item.Name: Event Identifier
Item.Description: The event identifier as a string.

Item.Name: Start Time
Item.Description: Time when the load control event will start started.

Item.Name: Duration In Min
Item.Description: The duration of the load control event.

Item.Name: Critical Level
Item.Description: The criticality of the event. The device receiving the event will react in an appropriate fashion for the device.

Item.Name: Avg Load AdjPct
Item.Description: Defines the maximum energy usage of the receiving device, as a percentage of the device's normal maximum energy usage.

Item.Name: Duty Cycle
Item.Description: Defines the duty cycle for the load control event, i.e, what percentage of time the receiving device is allowed to be on.

Item.Name: On/Off
Item.Description: This resource represents an on/off actuator, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off.

Item.Name: Dimmer
Item.Description: This resource represents a dimmer setting, which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Item.Name: On time
Item.Description: The time in seconds that the device has been turned on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Item.Name: Muti-state Output
Item.Description: A string describing a state for multiple level output such as Pilot Wire

Item.Name: Set Point Value
Item.Description: The setpoint value.

Item.Name: Busy to Clear delay
Item.Description: Delay from the detection state to the clear state in ms

Item.Name: Clear to Busy delay
Item.Description: Delay from the clear state to the busy state in ms.

Item.Name: Host Device Manufacturer
Item.Description: Human readable host device manufacturer name

Item.Name: Host Device Model Number
Item.Description: A host device model identifier (manufacturer specified string)

Item.Name: Host Device Unique ID
Item.Description: The host device unique ID is assigned by AT&T as the “Device ID” in the onboarding tool and will be stored in

Item.Name: Host Device Software Version
Item.Description: Current software version of the host device. (manufacturer specified string).
